case1.text: John Peterson, a 45-year-old male, presents with persistent headache for 3 days accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light. He reports no prior history of migraines. Physical examination reveals normal vital signs with no neurological deficits. Diagnosis: migraine without aura. Treatment: ibuprofen 400mg every 6 hours as needed for pain, rest in a dark quiet room. Follow-up in 2 weeks if symptoms persist.

case2.text: Sarah Lim, a 32-year-old female, complains of intermittent chest pain and shortness of breath during exercise for the past 2 months. No known cardiac history. Blood pressure is 130/85 mmHg, pulse 88 bpm. ECG shows nonspecific ST changes. She is recommended to undergo a stress test and echocardiogram for further evaluation.

case3.text: David Chen, a 10-year-old boy, presents with fever (38.5°C), sore throat, and swollen lymph nodes for 4 days. A rapid strep test comes back positive. Diagnosis: streptococcal pharyngitis. Treatment: prescribed penicillin VK 500mg twice daily for 10 days. Symptomatic relief with acetaminophen recommended.

case4.text: Today's weather forecast predicts a high of 28°C with scattered showers in the afternoon. In sports news, the Lakers beat the Celtics in overtime with a final score of 112-108. No significant updates in politics or economy.

case5.text: Emily Rogers, a 67-year-old female, presents with worsening shortness of breath, fatigue, and ankle swelling over the past 3 weeks. She has a history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes. On examination: blood pressure 140/90 mmHg, bilateral pitting edema, and crackles at the lung bases. Diagnosis: congestive heart failure. Treatment plan includes low sodium diet, furosemide 40mg daily, and close outpatient follow-up.

case6.text: Michael Brown, a 29-year-old male, was involved in a motor vehicle accident. He is conscious but complains of severe pain in the right leg. X-ray confirms a mid-shaft femur fracture. Vital signs stable. No head trauma noted. Plan: surgical repair with intramedullary nail fixation, followed by physical rehabilitation.
